spring.why: Freeze-thaw cycles commonly loosen or crack shingles, creating leak paths.
spring.look: Missing, curled, cracked, or displaced shingles.
spring.mistake: Assuming leaks only show up inside.
spring.pro: If multiple shingles are damaged or roof is steep.
spring.note: Roof damage is often visible from the ground with binoculars.

spring.why: Improper flashing is one of the most common sources of water intrusion.
spring.look: Rust, gaps, lifted edges, or missing sealant.
spring.mistake: Relying on caulk alone instead of proper flashing.
spring.pro: If flashing is embedded or integrated with roofing.
spring.note: Sealants fail; metal flashing is the primary defense.

spring.why: Blocked gutters cause overflow that damages siding and foundations.
spring.pro: If gutters are high or improperly sloped.
spring.note: Overflow stains are evidence of past problems.
